abstract: Cisco Systems, the maker of equipment for computer networking, said early Friday that it planned to buy the social-networking software maker Five Across for an undisclosed sum, expanding into user-generated content. CNET News.com described the latest deal as part of Cisco’s effort to diversify beyond being “plumbers of the Internet” into more consumer-focused areas. InfoWorld suggests that Cisco also expects social-networking technology to be embraced by businesses as well.
lead_paragraph: Cisco Systems, the maker of equipment for computer networking, said early Friday that it planned to buy the social-networking software maker Five Across for an undisclosed sum, expanding into user-generated content. CNET News.com described the latest deal as part of Cisco’s effort to diversify beyond being “plumbers of the Internet” into more consumer-focused areas. InfoWorld suggests that Cisco also expects social-networking technology to be embraced by businesses as well.

headline.main: Cisco to Buy Social-Networking Software Maker
